alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 11:10PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Showers with strong wind gusts will impact portions of Buchanan, McDowell, Mingo, south central Lincoln, Logan and Wyoming Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1108 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Varney to near Glen Burke. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamson, Welch, Logan, Grundy, Pineville, Oceana, Chapmanville, Gary, War, Man, Delbarton, Northfork, Gilbert Creek, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Mallory, Hinch, Hanover, R.D. Bailey Lake, Chief Logan State and Holden. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
